oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Department of Energy Photograph Collection
Little Bikini blast to open the gates of the city
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A cloud of smoke is in center with photographers on a platform. Men in uniform are on the left.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cameras; Elza Gate; Gates; Opening of the Gates; Photographers; Reporters; Uniforms
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: See Oak Ridge Journal of March 21, 1949. "The magnesium ribbon was ignited by an atomic impulse carried from Oak Ridge National Laboratory after Dr. George Felback, vice president of Carbide, telephoned the signal from the gate. " (Elza)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Physical rights are retained by the institution. Copyright is retained in accordance with U. S. Copyright laws.
